item.title: Stellar Blade Director Receives Recognition from South Korean President
item.content:encoded:
Hyung-tae Kim, the CEO of Shift Up and the director behind Stellar Blade, has received a Presidential Commendation in South Korea. This prestigious awardwas presented by the South Korean President himself, and it was given for Kimâ€™s services to the domestic game industry.

While Stellar Blade was mentioned, the award was also given amidst recognition of Shift Upâ€™s other games, like Goddess of Victory: NIKKE.

Stellar Blade Was a Game-Changing Title

Stellar Blade first dropped in April 2024, before being released on PC a little more than a year later. The game would go on to sell millions of copies, with players being pulled in by the visuals and staying for the combat and intriguing story.

Itâ€™s no big secret that much of the attraction in Stellar Blade rests with the gameâ€™s protagonist, Eve. Her character model was built around a scanned representation of a South Korean glamour model, which gives you an idea of why the character was such a hit with gamers.

As revealed by Automaton Media, Hyung-tae Kim, the visionary director behind Shift Upâ€™s Stellar Blade, recently received an award from the South Korean President, Lee Jae Myung. This commendation was bestowed upon Kim because of his contributions to the industry and â€˜achievements in overseas expansionâ€™.

In the report, it was stressed that Kim â€˜humbly thanked his development teams and Shift Upâ€™ for their pivotal work on bringing Stellar Blade to life.

In September, it was confirmed that a Stellar Blade sequel was in development and moving along quite nicely. In November, reports were circulated suggesting that Shift Up was targeting more platforms for further Steller Blade expansion, eyeing up the likes of Xbox and Nintendo.

Did you ever play Stellar Blade? Let us know what you thought about the game on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Phantom Blade Zero could come to Xbox

item.title: Red Bull Has Turned 2000 Drones Into the Worldâ€™s Largest Game of Tetris
item.content:encoded:
Red Bull has created the worldâ€™s largest game of Tetris powered by 2000 drones as a part of the Red Bull Tetris World final.

The special event saw Red Bull use the iconic 150-metre high Dubai Frame, which opened in 2018, as the border for the Tetris game, which Red Bull says made the game the â€œworldâ€™s first open-air, live playable Tetris gameâ€.

A grand total of 2800 drones were used for the game, with each player needing 1400 drones per game due to the dronesâ€™ battery life.

Fehmi Atalar of TÃ¼rkiye went home as the champion of the game, achieving a score of 168,566 during the five-minute game. Leo SolÃ³rzano of Peru managed a score of 57,164.

Red Bull described the event as â€œphone to drone, with Qualifiers featuring participants in 60 countries playing directly on their mobile devices.

â€œThis event was one of a kind. Itâ€™s not a thing you can describe in words,â€ said Red Bull Tetris World final winner Fehmi Atalar.

â€œOver [my] five years of Tetris experience, this was the best moment, and this event was one of a kind. Itâ€™s not a thing you can describe in words,â€ Atalar concluded. â€œI managed to play like a machine, and although I could have done things a bit cleaner, I achieved a flawless run and did not miss a single point in any of my matches, so I am very happy.â€

What do you think of 2000+ drones making the worldâ€™s largest game of Tetris? Share your thoughts on this update through the free-to-play Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Phantom Blade Zero Isnâ€™t A PS5 Console Exclusive Forever, Could Come To Xbox
item.content:encoded:
S-GAME is looking to deliver its A-game with Phantom Blade Zero. The hack â€˜nâ€™ slasher looks slick and quick, and will be the action game to watch out for in 2026. PS5 gamers are eyeing it up, but it might not stay this way forever.

The Phantom Blade Zero release date was finally revealed at The Game Awards 2025. Itâ€™s going to add to an incredibly stacked year of gaming, and the pre-release hype is already big. Early marketing has made it clear it will launch on PS5â€”and PCâ€”and not Xbox. Yet.

Phantom Blade Zero Could Release On Xbox

Itâ€™s amazing how often little details are picked up on by players days after a new trailer or announcement. The Game Awards 2025 is well behind us, but only now is it apparent that Phantom Blade Zeroâ€™s Release Date trailer had new information in plain sight.

At the very end of the four-minute trailer, a big blue screen pops up with an interesting message: â€œPlayStation 5 Console Exclusive.â€

This was already known. However, as you should with all contracts, if you read the fine print, thereâ€™s more than meets the eye:

â€œAlso available on PC. Not available on other consoles until at least 12 months after the release date.â€

Simply, this means Phantom Blade Zero is a timed exclusive. Like Silent Hill 2 or Square Enixâ€™s Final Fantasy Remake games, it will launch on PS5 first (on consoles), and then we could easily see an Xbox port later down the line.

More than likely, this is what will happen. The console wars are over, and it seems to be about maximizing profits for Sony and Microsoft. It will get to the point where pretty much every game is on every other consoleâ€”apart from Nintendo, donâ€™t expect Mario on PS5 anytime soon!

Hereâ€™s the full Phantom Blade Zero trailer from TGA 2025.

Will Phantom Blade Zero be a day-one buy on PS5 or PC? Or does this revelation give you enough hope to hang on for a possible Xbox port later down the road? Share your thoughts on this update through the free-to-play Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more IG news, read about Lords of the Fallen 2â€™s CEO saying the game has â€˜Attractive Female Charactersâ€™ in â€˜Revealing Outfits,â€™ and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 4 multiplayer reportedly being â€˜A Complete Copy of Modern Warfare 2.â€™

item.title: Leaks Reveal Winter Wildcards As Next EA FC 26 Promo
item.content:encoded:
Winter Wildcards has been expected to make its return to EA FC 26 for weeks, but new leaks now suggest the festive promo is officially next in line. Set to begin on Friday, December 19 at the usual 6 PM UK time, this yearâ€™s edition is shaping up to be the biggest Winter Wildcards event the series has ever seen.

And for once, itâ€™s not just the player list doing the rounds. The leaks for EA FC 26 have been unusually broad, hinting at everything from significant new card upgrades to multiple versions of the same players with differing positions and stat tweaks. With so much information surfacing early, anticipation for this yearâ€™s Winter Wildcards is building fastâ€”if the leaks hold true, youâ€™re in for a truly wild festive promo.

According to reliable leaker FUT Sheriff on X, a flood of new details has emerged about the upcoming Winter Wildcards promo in EA FC 26â€”and thereâ€™s plenty to get excited about. The standout reveal is the suggestion that three full promo teams are on the way. With EA recently sticking to rapid-fire, one-week promos, a longer, more substantial festive event would be a welcome change and give players something meatier to dig into over the holiday period.

But thatâ€™s far from the only headline. Another major leak claims that a select group of Winter Wildcards cards will become the first items in EA FC 26 to receive two PlayStyles+, marking a significant shift in the gameâ€™s power structure. It appears EA is experimenting with gradually introducing higher-tier cards without abruptly breaking their slower power-curve philosophyâ€”and double PlayStyles+ could be their first step in that direction.

As for player names, the leaks are coming thick and fast. Icons like Zidane, IbrahimoviÄ‡, and Ronaldinho have already been mentioned, and more are expected as we get closer to launch. If you want to stay on top of every new Winter Wildcards leak, Football Gaming Zone will be updating fans with all the latest information as it drops.

Are you looking forward to Winter Wildcards in EA FC 26? Who do you hope to see included in the promo? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord, and donâ€™t forget to check out FGZ for consistent EA FC 26 news and leaks.

For more Insider Gaming content, check out the largest update in Fallout Shelterâ€™s history, as well as the Lords Of The Fallen 2 CEOâ€™s comments on female character designs.
